content: Which famous artist created the sculpture "The Thinker"?

"The Thinker" is a renowned sculpture created by the famous French artist Auguste Rodin. Rodin was a prolific sculptor who lived from 1840 to 1917 and is widely considered one of the most important figures in modern sculpture. "The Thinker," originally titled "The Poet," was conceived as part of his monumental work "The Gates of Hell," inspired by Dante's "Inferno." The sculpture depicts a nude man deep in thought, sitting with his chin resting on his hand. Over time, "The Thinker" has become an iconic representation of philosophy and intellectual endeavor.
